results.title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
results.creator_credit: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.brief_description: An epic love story and action drama set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai and Yu Shu Lien are duty bound warriors whose unspoken love spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu and Lo represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sony Pictures, Columbia Pictures, Good Machine International, EDKO Film, Zoom Hunt International, China Films Co-Production, Asian Union Film and Entertainment, Bill Kong, Ligong Xu and Ang Lee
results.description: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)
description_for_label: An epic love story and action drama, set in China during the Qing dynasty, revolving around two sets of lovers. Li Mu Bai (Chow Yun Fat) and Yu Shu Lien (Michelle Yeoh) are cast as duty bound warriors whose unspoken love for each other spans decades. By comparison, their young romantic counterparts Jen Yu (a promising young warrior) and Lo (her bandit lover) represent freedom, youth and unrestrained love. After Li surrenders his legendary sword to Yu and vows to stop fighting, his plans to retire are halted when the sword is stolen. In their quest to recover it, Li and Yu confront the evil forces headed by Jade Fox who is attempting to recruit the impressionable young Jen Yu to her cause. As the opposing forces of good and evil battle to secure the sword, they also struggle to lure Jen Lu to their side. Based on an early 20th century novel by Wang Du Lu, the project was scripted by Wang Hui Ling, James Schamus and Tsai Kuo Jung. Photographed by Peter Pau. Martial arts choreography by Yuen Wo-Ping. (Awards: Academy Awards 2001, Best Foreign Film, Best Music Score, Best Art Direction and Best Cinematography)

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Sean Croyston, Jason Camenzuli, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.

results.title: Crossroads. Eight miles high
results.creator_credit: High Thomson, Mick Conefrey, Alan Lewens, Karen Walsh, WGBH (Boston) and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Dancing in the street: a rock and roll history”.
The Blues crosses the Atlantic and reaches Britain where it finds a new direction. Groups like the Beatles and the Rolling Stones invade America and somewhere in the process Heavy Metal is invented. In this episode entitled ‘Crossroads’, interviews and performances by legendary musicians such as The Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, Jeff Beck are featured. In the second program ‘Eight miles high’ the whole phenomenon of Psychadelia is explored, including interviews and clips from The Grateful Dead, Janis Joplin and Pink Floyd. This episode captures a landmark era in the development of rock music in the 1960’s.

results.title: Crossroads Rock Concert
results.creator_credit: Salvation Army, Salvation Army. Australia Southern Territory and Richard Hodder
results.brief_description: Three Christian rock groups gig together in aid of Salvation Army’s Crossroads Program for Homeless Youth, interspersed with modern parables about being young and different from the crowd. “Crossroads” is a video about, and for, contemporary Christian youth.

results.title: Crossroads of life
results.creator_credit: Henri Storck and United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: Hihglights several cases of children with serious problems, who are helped to understand their needs and become healthier people. After becoming delinquent, they are treated in a children’s institution. Scenes show therapeutic work to help them relieve aggressive feelings. International cooperation to improve methods of prevention, observation and treatment of delinquency is urged.

results.title: Crossroads
results.creator_credit: Mark Carliner, Columbia Pictures and Walter Hill
results.brief_description: Long ago, Willie Brown bargained his soul with the Devil at the crossroads in return for fame. Gifted young guitarist Eugene (Ralph Maccio) will do anything to play the blues like his legendary hero and travels across country where he meets the now old and cantankerous Willie. Together they journey to the fated crossroads and Eugene learns that to really play the blues, you must live them first. Joe Seneca and Jami Gertz also star in this production which features an incredible soundtrack by Ry Cooder.

results.title: Crossing the Great Sagrada
results.creator_credit: Priceless Pictures, All-Britisch Productions, Adrian Brunel and Lionel Rich
results.brief_description: In 1924, during one of the periodic slumps in the British film industry, Adrian Brunel amused himself and many others by producing a series of burlesques. This film tells of Holmes, Sweet and Holmes’ voyage by sea to Africa where they then set off, on camels, across the desert to finally arrive at the famous Cascara of Sagrada falls. A comic travel film of the silent era.
